author: holiman
content: Hey ho! I'd like to iron out a minor wrinkle in the EL spec, to align CL and EL withdrawals-json. More info: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/27129

author: siladu
content:
I don't think engine API _needs_ to align names with beacon API, but agree it might be nice.
It's more important to me that engine API fields are internally consistent and engine API uses camelCase all over so I wouldn't agree to just changing one field
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/shanghai.md

author: siladu
content: oh, I guess you might be talking about eth_getBlockBy* rather than engine api...that would be annoying in besu since the Withdrawal object is shared between both APIs :/ (but also the same argument stands about getBlockBy* using camelCase already)

author: holiman
content: I am talking about withdrawals wherever they appear really, but specifically the point I raised was in thw context of a block, e.g eth_getBlockXx . Seems silly to not align on new things. Can't really blame legacy.

author: siladu
content: I guess the trade off is creating "internal" (still exposed to users though) inconsistency within one API for the sake of _some_ consistency across EL/CL specs. Not really sure the benefit of aligning EL APIs with CL APIs is worth it. If we change one field, then the API will be inconsistent both internally and across EL/CL boundary (for fields other than withdrawals).
